intro: Conostylis serrulata, commonly known as the serrated conostylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, serrated leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers arranged in spikes, which bloom during the spring and summer seasons. It is typically found in coastal regions and sandy soils, often in heathlands or open woodlands. Conostylis serrulata is an important component of local ecosystems, providing habitat and food for various native insects and birds.
